idlastro/

make_2d.pro


top source make_2d

make_2d, x, y, xx, yy

NAME: MAKE_2D PURPOSE: Change from 1-d indexing to 2-d indexing EXPLANATION: Convert an N element X vector, and an M element Y vector, into N x M arrays giving all possible combination of X and Y pairs. Useful for obtaining the X and Y positions of each element of a regular grid.

CALLING SEQUENCE: MAKE_2D, X, Y, [ XX, YY ]

INPUTS: X - N element vector of X positions Y - M element vector of Y positions

OUTPUTS: XX - N x M element array giving the X position at each pixel YY - N x M element array giving the Y position of each pixel If only 2 parameters are supplied then X and Y will be updated to contain the output arrays

EXAMPLE: To obtain the X and Y position of each element of a 30 x 15 array

IDL> x = indgen(30) & y = indgen(15) IDL> make_2d, x, y REVISION HISTORY: Written, Wayne Landsman ST Systems Co. May, 1988 Added /NOZERO keyword W. Landsman Mar, 1991 Converted to IDL V5.0 W. Landsman September 1997 Improved speed P. Broos July 2000

Parameters

x
y
xx
yy
